Crime_Name: Discrimination under Canadian Human Rights Act
Legal_Issue: Whether the Commission erred in dismissing the complaint of gender-based discrimination
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed differential treatment by her union based on gender; non-payment of union dues cited as reason for dismissal by Commission; applicant argued she remained a member and linked non-payment to alleged discrimination
Court_Ruling: Court overturned the Commission's decision and remanded the case for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Union refused representation due to unpaid dues
Legal_Standard: Prima facie case of discrimination; jurisdictional requirements under Section 41
Assessment_Factor: Existence of jurisdiction; plausibility of prima facie discrimination claim
Evidence_Used: Applicant's arguments linking non-payment of dues to gender-based discrimination
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 41 of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Application_Basis: Complaint of discriminatory treatment by union
Evidence_Assessed: Applicant's explanation for non-payment of dues and allegations of gender-based treatment
Relief_Sought: Reconsideration of complaint by the Commission
Governing_Rule: Under Section 41, Commission must address complaints unless exceptions apply
Harm_Assessment: Alleged denial of union representation due to gender-based discrimination
Cause_Description: Applicant alleged gender-based discrimination by her union, which refused representation due to unpaid dues
Evidence_Handling: Commission failed to adequately consider applicant's arguments
Evidence_Issues: Failure to consider contextual evidence linking non-payment to discrimination
Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether the Commission had jurisdiction despite non-payment of dues
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of applicantâ€™s justification for non-payment
Decision_Rationale: Commission unreasonably dismissed complaint without evaluating key arguments
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of thorough assessment of applicant's evidence and explanations
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard in judicial review; prima facie discrimination test
